description.narrative:
The Thematic Programme on Governance and Rights contributes to promoting rule of law accountability and rights for poor and vulnerable people. This is be done in partnership with duty bearers, right-based NGOs, watchdogs and international organisations. The programme also addresses combating violence against thousands of women that have been victims of domestic violence. Also, the partners take up public litigation in order to change legal practice to the benefit of the poor and marginalised. The Thematic Programme consist of seven DE partnerships with various civil society organisations as well as GoB and UN agencies.
The Thematic Programme Governance and Rights Unallocated This is not a regular engagement rather some unallocated funds are kept without earmarking. There will not be any indicators or results reporting aaginst this engagement. That is why this engagement is being deactivated.
"Promotion of rule of law, accountability and rights for poor and vulnerable groups”

title.narrative: 1) WB Global Governance Indicators 1a Rule of Law, 1b Control of Corruption)*) 2) Freedom House Indicators : 2a: Theme C: Functioning of the Government: 2b): Theme F: Rule of law #) 3) SDG 16.2.3: (Proportion of young men and women 18-29 year who experienced sexual violence by age 18) §) 4) Corruption Perceptions Index (Transparency international) €)

comment.narrative: Improved rule of law, enhanced accountability and inclusive service delivery and more respect for human rights, incl. for women, poor workers and indigenous people
